metadata.title: CVE-2015-6251 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Double free vulnerability in GnuTLS before 3.3.17 and 3.4.x before 3.4.4allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a longDistinguishedName (DN) entry in a certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6251` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.3.15-5ubuntu2
guile-gnutls - 3.3.15-5ubuntu2
libgnutls-deb0-28 - 3.3.15-5ubuntu2
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.3.15-5ubuntu2
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.3.15-5ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.3.15-5ubuntu2').
